column2: We are seeking a motivated and results-oriented Inventory and Distribution Manager to play a key role in optimizing our supply chain. You will be responsible for playing role of control tower for service managing upstream and downstream variabilities.              You will be overseeing all aspects of distribution operations, inventory management, reducing SLOB, improving freshness standards, and automation initiatives in distribution.                  Key skills will be understanding the business dynamics of managing a vast array of SKU-DC combinations and expertise in inventory management systems and principals.              Further, you are expected to have qualities of translating data from an array of sources into insights and go-forward recommendations, consensus building and influencing at senior levels, strong communication skills, and accountability to driving exceptional results with a sense of urgency.                Responsibilities:                          Implement ABC and XYZ analysis to categorize inventory and optimize stock levels based on value and demand.                      Establish and manage safety stock levels to mitigate stockouts while minimizing holding costs.                      Analyze inventory data to identify trends, identifying mitigation plans for SLOB inventory.                      Manage the efficient flow of goods through the distribution centers.                      What We Are Looking For                 Minimum 5 years of experience in planning and operations          Proven track record of optimizing inventory levels and reducing costs.          Experience with logistics and warehousing is a plus.          Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills          Strong communication, collaboration, and leadership skills          Ability to work independently and as part of a team.          Proficient in SAP, Pando etc                         What s In It For You                                 Competitive Benefit Package                      Paid Company Holidays, Paid Vacation, Volunteer Time, Summer Fridays & More!                      Learning & Development Opportunities                      Employee Resource Groups

column2: Job description   Sampada is a niche ethnic womens wear brand. We have our retail outlets in Delhi, Mumbai, Bangalore and Chennai. We also retail through our online store. Currently, we are looking out for Warehouse In-Charge.   The warehouse In-Charge must achieve inventory accuracy, coordinate order fulfillment, and track logistics. The ideal candidate is exceptionally detail-oriented and able to manage multiple facets of warehouse operations simultaneously. The roles and responsibilities are as follows:   Develop warehouse operations systems by determining product handling and storage requirements, equipment utilization, inventory, gate processes, and shipping methods. Train and manage the warehouse team to solve day-to-day operational issues and reach short- and long-term performance goals. Review and prepare workflows, staffing requirements, space allocations, and action plans that meet company standards for productivity, quality, and customer service. Maintain a safe and healthy work environment by establishing and enforcing standards and procedures and by complying with legal regulations. Supervise daily warehouse activities, including quality assurance, inventory control, space management, logistics and customer service. Coordination with pan India stores and fulfilling store inventory requirements.  Manage logistics for transporting products to all the stores and company facilities, communicating with driver to ensure efficient delivery of goods. Receiving and processing warehouse stock products. Performing warehouse inventory controls and keeping quality standards high for audits. Prepare and complete orders for delivery or pickup according to schedule (load, pack, wrap, label, ship). Perform inventory controls and keep quality standards high for audits. Keep a clean and safe working environment and optimise space utilization. Complete diary logs into inventory. Report any inventory discrepancies. Communicate and cooperate with Merchandising Team.  Proven working experience as a Warehouse In charge. Proficiency in inventory software, databases and systems. Familiarity with modern warehousing practices and methods. Good organizational and time management skills. Manage inventory management system conforming to standard warehouse practice (Bar Code, SKU, FIFO, etc.) and apply new warehouse technologies to minimize errors and improve operational warehouse facility. Coordinate with the  merchandising , sample department, Quality, and Production team and ensure for smooth process.  Ensure smooth process for an exhibition cum sale in pan India.  All loading and unloading for incoming and outgoing Inventory. Daily update inventory data to respective merchandisers and management. Proven experience as inventory In-Charge or similar position. Excellent knowledge of data analysis and forecasting methods Working knowledge of inventory management software (e.g. ERP) Ability to accurately track inventory and create reports. Excellent organizational and planning skills. Outstanding communication and interpersonal abilities   Job Type: Full-time   Experience: Warehouse In-Charge: 1-to-2-years (Required) total work: 1 to 2 years (Required) Ability to Commute: Anand Vihar, Delhi, Delhi (Required) Ability to Relocate: Anand Vihar, Delhi, Delhi: Relocate before starting work (Required). Education: Bachelor?? (Preferred)   Work Location: In person

column2: Brief Summary In this role you will be responsible for effectively managing the inventory of gold, solitaires, and other materials in accordance with the company's guidelines and standards. Your primary focus will be on ensuring accurate inventory records, efficient stock movement, and maintaining the quality of materials. This role requires a strong attention to detail, excellent organizational skills, and relevant experience in inventory management. Brief Job Description (just an indicative list and not limited to the following) 1. Melt gold received from customers in exchange for new jewellery. 2. Segregate pure gold from other impurities and ensure accurate measurement and purity determination. 3. Add pure gold to inventory and update stock records accordingly. 4. Collaborate with relevant teams to address any discrepancies or issues related to gold inventory. 5. Coordinate with vendors for the inwarding of solitaires. 6. Conduct thorough quality checks to ensure the authenticity and integrity of the solitaires received. 7. Verify the quantity and quality of solitaires against purchase orders and update inventory records accordingly. 8. Inventory Management: Maintain accurate and up-to-date records of inventory, including gold, solitaires, and other materials. 9. Regularly monitor stock levels, identify slow-moving or obsolete items, and take appropriate actions to optimize inventory turnover. 10. Coordinate with other departments, such as sales and production, to ensure the availability of materials to meet customer demands. 11. Implement inventory control procedures to minimize stock loss, damage, or theft. 12. Conduct periodic physical inventory counts to reconcile actual stock with system records. 13. Prepare reports and documentation related to inventory levels, stock movement, and any inventory-related discrepancies. 14. Analyze inventory data to identify trends, forecast demand, and make recommendations for inventory optimization. 15. Provide regular updates to management on inventory status, highlighting any potential risks or opportunities. Skill Required 1. Bachelor's degree preferred. 2. 2+ years of inventory management experience 3. Knowledge of gold purity assessment and solitaire evaluation 4. Proficient in inventory management software and MS Excel 5. Strong attention to detail and organizational skills 6. Excellent communication and problem-solving abilities   Interested candidates can share their resumes on 88283 00920 or share ankita.ghadigaonkar@orra.co.in

column1: Senior Supply Chain Executive - Inventory Controller
column2: Role & responsibilities  : Implement and manage Group inventory control processes using Dynamics 365 ERP. Implement strategies to reduce Group inventory as per Company goals. Conduct regular audits to ensure accuracy in Group stock levels, promptly identifying and resolving discrepancies. Monitor and analyse Group inventory turnover rates, Inventory in day, Inventory ageing, ABC Analysis , SLOB report , spend analysis ,MRP monitoring and providing data-driven recommendations for overall improvement. Analyse inventory statistics to enhance the company's inventory situation, identifying product trends. Place inventory orders, track shipments, and allocate inventory to the appropriate departments. Perform extensive research on various inventory-related reports and group purchasing trends. Conduct regular inventory counts and draft comprehensive inventory reports documenting counts and discrepancies. Report Group inventory statistics to management, suggesting improvements to inventory control processes. Coordinate with other teams to resolve discrepancies between inventory and revenue. Create and maintain accurate Group inventory databases and systems. Responsible for designing and implementing central data management system for Group Product master data in D365. Contribute to back up plan and adhoc requirements in supply chain department. Create and design process maps for supply chain processes to control Inventory. Train and mentor other Group team members to understand the D365 Supply chain processes. Preferred candidate profile  : Bachelors degree in mechanical engineering and Certification in Supply chain management, business administration, marketing, or a related field. Excellent communication and organizational skills. Proficiency in databases and spreadsheets; strong computer skills. Solid analytical, time management, and problem-solving skills. Exceptional attention to detail, mathematical proficiency, and multitasking abilities. Analytical mindset with acute commercial awareness; capable of interpreting and implementing data on trends and spending.

column2: Role & responsibilities   Job Description: Overview: The Inventory Executive assumes a pivotal role in the organization and is tasked with the delicate balance of managing inventory levels to align with customer demand while mitigating excess stock. This position holds paramount importance in maintaining operational efficiency and customer satisfaction. Key responsibilities include overseeing inventory control processes, analyzing intricate inventory data, and strategizing to enhance inventory performance. By meticulously monitoring inventory levels and implementing optimization strategies, the Inventory Executive ensures that the organization operates smoothly, meeting customer needs promptly and effectively while minimizing unnecessary inventory costs. Key Responsibilities: Inventory Management: Develop and maintain inventory management policies and procedures. Monitor inventory levels and ensure accuracy through regular audits and cycle counts. Coordinate with procurement and production teams to ensure adequate stock levels to meet customer demand. Implement inventory optimization techniques to minimize stockouts and excess inventory. Data Analysis and Reporting: Analyse inventory data to identify trends, discrepancies, and areas for improvement. Generate regular reports on inventory performance metrics such as turnover rate, stock accuracy, and carrying costs. Utilize inventory management software systems to track inventory movements and generate reports. Forecasting and Planning: Collaborate with sales and demand planning teams to forecast future inventory needs. Develop inventory replenishment strategies based on demand forecasts and lead times. Monitor market trends and product lifecycle to adjust inventory plans accordingly. Process Improvement: Identify opportunities to streamline inventory management processes and improve efficiency. Implement best practices for inventory control, including FIFO, JIT, and safety stock levels. Continuously evaluate and optimize inventory management systems and technologies. Vendor Management: Maintain relationships with key suppliers and vendors to ensure timely delivery of inventory. Negotiate pricing, terms, and contracts with suppliers to optimize inventory costs. Resolve any issues related to supplier performance, quality, or delivery delays.   Key Skills and Competencies Analytical Skills:  Ability to analyze data and make informed decisions regarding inventory levels and purchasing. Attention to Detail:  Meticulous attention to detail to ensure accurate inventory tracking and reporting. Organizational Skills:  Strong organizational skills to manage multiple tasks and projects simultaneously. Communication Skills:  Effective communication skills to liaise with suppliers, logistics providers, and internal stakeholders. Leadership Abilities:  Leadership and team management skills to oversee and motivate inventory staff. Command on Excel:  VLOOKUP, HLOOKUP, Pivot Table, SUM, COUNTIF, IF & other formulas. Qualifications: Bachelor's degree in supply chain management, Logistics, Business Administration, or related field. Proven experience in inventory management, preferably in a manufacturing or retail environment. Proficiency in inventory management software and MS Excel for data analysis and reporting. Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with attention to detail. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills for collaborating with cross-functional teams. Ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment and adapt to changing priorities. Knowledge of inventory optimization techniques and best practices. Certification in inventory management (e.g., CPIM) is a plus.

column2: Company Profile:  Company is established in 2019, engaged in providing repair and maintenance services related to Oilfield equipment. Currently business is in expansion mode due to huge market opportunities available. Position: Store Executive / Inventory Controller cum Admin   We are looking for a dedicated and reliable store cum admin in charge to join our growing company. Your chief goal will include: Placing order and expediting receipt of material based on approved purchase order. Develop inventory tracking system. Maintain, record, monitor and report on companys inventory, tools and equipment movement. Ensure all factory administration processes are carried on timely basis to run business smoothly. Job Profile: Verify quantity of Inventory, Tools, Equipment etc with invoice and other supporting documents at the time of factory IN and OUT. Recording of IN and OUT inventory, Tools, Equipment etc in register. Verify IN and OUT register maintained at Factory Gate. Keep proper records of inventory, tools, equipment lying in factory premises along with physical location. Physical inventory verification with books at regular interval and reporting to the Manager. Preparation of Purchase Order based on approvals by Manager and communication with supplier on this regard. Communication and co-ordination with suppliers on quotes, material delivery etc.  Collect attendance sheet from Technician and submit for payment after verification. Maintain attendance of staff and Technician. Prepare cost sheet as per companys format in consultation with accounts team. E way bill generation as per GST Act. Submit purchase and expense invoices received at factory to Accounts team and related communication. Routine Admin work.  Location:  Navi Mumbai. Requirements: Strong communication skills. Bachelors degree in relevant field. Minimum 2-3 years experience in similar role. Preferably in hardware industry. Well versed in MS Office. Preferably Male candidate living nearby Navi Mumbai area or ready to relocate nearby. Salary : Best in the Industry.
